revised_title: Improving the Sensitivity and Accuracy of the Cavendish Experiment
tldr: The author describes improvements to the Cavendish experiment, a method for measuring the Newtonian constant of gravitation, by reducing the size of the apparatus and using quartz fibers for torsion. The author also discusses the advantages of using a cylindrical tube for hanging the beam and the importance of minimizing disturbances due to convection in achieving high accuracy.
